text.0:
Are the lights off in large parts of Ghana as being claimed by CEO of Ovation International, @DeleMomodu?

Here is a #WebVideoFactCheck after we engaged the PRO of the Electricity Company of Ghana (ECG), William Boateng. #GhanaElection2020 #GhanaElectionFactCheck https://t.co/5buXWMhEmG
text.1: 2/2 This data was sourced from CrowdTangle, a Facebook-owned analytics platform.
text.2: 1/2 Here are the top-performing link posts by Ghanaian Facebook pages in the last 3 hours. #ElectionDay #ghanaelections2020 #GhanaElectionFactCheck https://t.co/YSEtjJ3hzf
text.3:
Are the lights off in large parts of Ghana as claimed by CEO of Ovation International, @DeleMomodu?

The PRO of the Electricity Company of Ghana (ECG), William Boateng has confirmed only parts of the Ashanti and Eastern regions have been affected. #GhanaElectionFactCheck https://t.co/YbbAij5WG7
text.4:
Are the lights off in large parts of Ghana as being claimed by CEO of Ovation International, @DeleMomodu ?

We engaged the PRO of the Electricity Company of Ghana (ECG), William Boateng.

https://t.co/TEgqWsHnNd

text.8:
𝗖𝗟𝗔𝗜𝗠: Police kills suspected ballot box snatcher in Awutu Senya West constituency.

𝗙𝗔𝗖𝗧-𝗖𝗛𝗘𝗖𝗞: @GhPoliceService has dismissed the claim as false. https://t.co/oDXZ46xnbX
text.9:

https://t.co/hpYSfWSwsY
text.10:
@AJEnglish in an online news report claims Ghanaians will be voting across “38,000” polling stations.

𝗙𝗔𝗖𝗧-𝗖𝗛𝗘𝗖𝗞:This is false because data from Ghana's Electoral Commission puts the figure at 33,367. https://t.co/btNBqvCppZ
text.11:
@AJEnglish claims Ghanaians will be voting across “38,000” polling stations.

𝗙𝗔𝗖𝗧-𝗖𝗛𝗘𝗖𝗞:
This is false because data from @ECGhanaOfficial puts the figure at 33,367.

https://t.co/kfLehPmhQl
text.12: @Buarteng @DeleMomodu Thank you for the alert. We will duly look into the claim.
text.13:
Ghana Election 2020: Armed men disrupt voting process at a polling station.

𝗩𝗘𝗥𝗗𝗜𝗖𝗧: False!
#ghanaelections2020 #ElectionDay #GhanaFactCheckingNetwork https://t.co/IYK4S1IMP4
text.14:
𝗖𝗟𝗔𝗜𝗠: Viral video being shared on social media shows armed men disrupting voting process at a polling station.

𝗙𝗔𝗖𝗧-𝗖𝗛𝗘𝗖𝗞: The video is a simulation exercise involving the @GhPoliceService. https://t.co/nuN84yyNQp

text.27: @GhPoliceService arrest EC officers for tampering with Presidential ballot. #ElectionDay #GhanaElectionFactCheck https://t.co/k3Ph2FEMUP
text.28: @ECGhanaOfficial has confirmed reports that there have been isolated cases of the presidential ballot papers being tampered with in Awutu Senya West and Bawku Central constituencies. #ElectionDay #GhanaElectionFactCheck https://t.co/WZx86wRtJc
text.29: Shooting incident in Kasoa, here is a short web video with all the details. #GhanaElectionFactCheck #ElectionDay https://t.co/EmKwzriy1X
text.31: @ECGhanaOfficial has confirmed reports that there have been isolated cases of the presidential ballot papers being tampered with in Awutu Senya West and Bawku Central constituencies. https://t.co/SLB4Oz9I6F
text.32:
Voters have a few more hours to the end of polls. You can still make it to your Polling Centre to exercise your civic responsibility.

#LetTheCitizenKnow
#GhanaElections https://t.co/KJGp7E3Iw6
text.34: @GhPoliceService has confirmed 2 people were injured in a shooting incident in Kasoa and not a "dozen voters" as claimed in an online report. https://t.co/DI6rX0DIny
text.35: 𝗞𝗪𝗘𝗦𝗜𝗠𝗜𝗡𝗧𝗜𝗠 𝗣𝗥𝗢𝗧𝗘𝗦𝗧: The image being shared on social media is misleading, but residents in the area did protest this morning. #ghanaelections2020 #ElectionDay #GhanaElectionFactCheck https://t.co/r3gWaZyhJ5
text.36: What do you do if you soil your ballot? #GhanaElections2020 #ElectionDay #GhanaElectionFactCheck https://t.co/X3XVMFkBms

text.42: 𝗙𝗔𝗟𝗦𝗘: Viral video encourages people to use their little finger to vote and claims EC has produced ballot papers that disadvantages @JDMahama. #ElectionDay #ghanaelections2020 #GhanaElectionFactCheck https://t.co/QbW9T8d2lr
text.45: @NanaYaw87345876 @ameyaw112 @eugeniatenkoran The electoral laws of Ghana forbid any open display of party colours and paraphernalia at the polling centres or anywhere around it on voting day. Failure to comply is a breach of the law.
text.46:
As the people of Ghana go out to vote today, we wish everyone a peaceful election.

For credible information, follow:

Fact-checking orgs (verified by @factchecknet) - @ghana_fact and @dubawaGH

Electoral Commission - @ECGhanaOfficial

Hashtags - #GhanaElections2020 #GhanaDecides https://t.co/ZZeSEqfGi2
text.47:
Let's not rush to post unverified claims about today's elections.

Please alert fact checking organizations like @ghana_fact to investigate these claims.

Let's not boost/amplify fake news. Let's not allow ourselves to become tools in spreading fake news. Thank you! #GhanaDecides https://t.co/quHKRv82Db
text.48: @wunpini_fm Thank you for the alert. We're working on verifying the claim.
text.49: Pay attention and don't be deceived by FAKE/SATIRICAL websites. Here are some satire websites we've found in Ghana. #ElectionDay #ghanaelections2020 #GhanaElectionFactCheck https://t.co/uVlk7iyRHi
